snippet: An international effort to nudge President Bashar al-Assad toward peace talks ran into difficulties on Friday even before it got under way.
abstract: United Nations relief official Valerie Amos offers somber view of aid crisis in Syria, witnessing first-hand the death and destruction caused by the uprising; says she encountered resistance by the government to accept her emergency aid proposal, which would give UN relief workers unrestricted access to stricken areas.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Beirut, and Alan Cowell from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut; an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; Rick Gladstone from New York; and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An international effort to nudge President Bashar al-Assad toward peace talks ran into difficulties on Friday even before it got under way.

headline.seo: U.N. Relief Official Tells of Destruction in Syria
headline.main: U.N. Relief Chief Tells of Horrific Destruction in Syria and Official Resistance to Aid Plan
headline.print_headline: U.N. Relief Chief Tells of Horrific Destruction in Syria and Official Resistance to Aid Plan
